verifier

Class ActivationRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • verifier.ActivationRecord

  • public class ActivationRecord
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of this class represents a single record in the static chain (which is a set of variable bindings). The environment is simply a chain of these activation records (each which holds a set of bindings). The environment is extended by chaining on a new activation record. Only the evaluation of a let or a generic application (application of a non-primitive function to a set of arguments) can extend the environment. In the former case, the environment will be extended so that the bindings introduced in the let are accessible in the body of the let. In the latter case, the environment will be extended such that the argument variables are bound during the execution of the lambda's body.

    • Field Detail

      • END

        public static final ActivationRecord END
        This singleton marks the end of the chain. Perform an extend operation on this record in order to "create" an environment.

    • Method Detail

      • toASE

        public ASExpression toASE()
        Returns:
        This method returns the s-expression representation for this record.

      • setBindings

        public void setBindings(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Value> mappings)
        Call this method from a plugin to redefine what mappings the base activation record uses. To change bindings in the non-initial activation record, use extend().
        Parameters:
        mappings - Set these mappings in the base activation record.

      • extend

        public ActivationRecord extend(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Value> mappings)
        Extend an environment (a chain of activation records) by adding a new set of bindings.
        Parameters:
        mappings - These are the bindings that will be added.
        Returns:
        This method returns a reference to the new head of the activation record chain. This will be a newly allocated activation record which is chained on top of the target record that this operation was performed on.

      • lookup

        public Value lookup(java.lang.String name)
             throws NotFoundException
        Lookup a variable binding in the environment.
        Parameters:
        name - Lookup this identifier
        Returns:
        This method returns the value that the given identifier is bound to.
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - This method throws if the given variable is not bound in the target environment.

      • keySet

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keySet()
        Returns:
        This method returns a list of al the keys in this activation record.

      • extensions

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Value> extensions()
        Returns:
        This method returns a mapping of all bindings in this activation record and others higher up the static chain, excluding the top (end) activation record. This value should not be viewed as a representative collection of bindings -- this only contains the extensions to the activation record. This is useful if you'd like to serialize the activation record but leave out all the huge values (like sets, dags) that every other node can independently construct.
